question.questionA: Leaves semi-evergreen, lacking a shiny cuticle, spineless.
question.questionB: Leaves evergreen, with a shiny cuticle on the adaxial  surface, usually spiny.

question.questionA: Shrubs; leaves 1-4 cm, smooth and leathery on both surfaces; acorn with spiny cup.
question.questionB: Trees; leaves 3-7 cm, shiny above but coated with a white tomentum below; acorn cup not spiny.

question.questionA: Leaves variable in shape, dark green above; stipules thick and hairy; acorns bitter.
question.questionB: Leaves broadly oval or round, glaucous above; stipules membranous; acorns sweet.
